thread.title: Pics: ’It won’t be hard to spot us on track!’
thread.title_full: Pics: ’It won’t be hard to spot us on track!’

title: Pics: ’It won’t be hard to spot us on track!’
text:
Supercars: Lee Holdsworth reveals 2017 Preston Hire Racing livery February 17, 2017 2:00pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS A NEW livery will hopefully mirror a fresh start for Lee Holdsworth and Preston Hire Racing in 2017. 
Holdsworth and team owner Charlie Schwerkolt endured a horror 2016 season, a crash in Darwin leaving the former sidelined with injury for several races and the latter with a destroyed car. 
A bolder yellow and black livery adorns the No. 18 Holden this year, revealed at the team’s new workshop behind Schwerkolt’s Waverley Forklifts head office. 
“It’s great to reveal the car with the team and all of our sponsors. The yellow is seriously bright and looks awesome,” Holdsworth said. 
“It won’t be hard to spot the Preston Hire car on track.” Lee Holdsworth’s new Preston Hire Racing Supercars livery for 2017. Source: Supplied 
Holdsworth will again be partnered by Karl Reindler for the Pirtek Enduro Cup, but will work with a new engineer in Chris Stuckey for 2017. 
Much of the teams main backers have returned for 2017, joined by OnePure Natural Artesian Water, Credence Insurance Brokers and P1 Racewear. Lee Holdsworth’s new Preston Hire Racing Supercars livery for 2017. Source: Supplied 
“It’s been a massive six week turn around from an empty factory to a new state of the art facility right at my head office in Mount Waverley, so really proud of the whole team at Preston Hire Racing and Waverley Forklifts,” Schwerkolt said. 
“Just a big thank you to all of our partners, friends and staff of Team 18. We are so excited to go racing at Clipsal and I think we are in for a really good year.” Lee Holdsworth’s new Preston Hire Racing Supercars livery for 2017. Source: Supplied Karl Reindler, Charlie Schwerkolt and Lee Holdsworth. Source: Supplied
